page.title: 03COMMUNICATIONS IN PANTON
page.content: {PANTON}has one daily postal delivery brought by a red Royal Mail van.There are three regular deliverers:one woman and two men.They work on a rota system.Because there is no post box or post office nearby,any out going mail can be given to them to post. The majority of the dwellings have a tele- phone connected to the Wragby exchange which is automatic.At Sotby House,the farmer who also farms outside our area has a large private radio mast so that he has radio contact with his staff. On average,once a year the residents expect to be isolated by the snow. This has happened for the past two years and unless a farmer comes out with a snow plough to clear the roads then the lanes are impassable. The Highways department also come eventually to clear the roads.
